choices: The sun has risen and you are refreshed.
1.content:
Watching the shapes in the darkness, you feel a pang of hunger. Of course, being a vampire, you always hunger. Always. You lick your fangs in anticipation as the group moves closer.

Unfortunately, these are not dinner. These are the only hope for your future. You lean back against the brick wall and cross your arms, wondering why you must stoop to alliances. You are powerful, untouchable, rare.

You run your fingers through your thick black hair that hangs just past your shoulders. You wish you had taken advantage of the lonely woman who begged for death. At least then you wouldn't be tempted to damn the mission and feast upon the willingly innocent before you.

They step into the dim street lamp's circle of light and you shut your eyes briefly. You can hear their blood circulating, smell their fear, hear their hearts pound beneath tender flesh, smell their sweat.

"Ernoth?" Comes a sweet tendril of purity, a young woman standing closest, smelling sweetest.

"Yes, my dear, but do not call me that. The name is Bloome." You say as you open your eyes and drink in her beauty.

"I am Lily." She says, her human form young and shapely, her dark green gown clinging to her maiden form. You swallow.

"I am Snarl." Comes a deep growl. You roll your gaze over to the troll whose stench is overpoweringly strong.

"I am Shyntar." The dark skinned man moves forward and tosses his thick cloak over his shoulders, showing you his sharp sword. You fight down a laugh.

"Warrior?" You ask.

"Worse than that." He says and you know not what he speaks of.

"I am Eternelle." Comes the lilting female voice. You start, realizing for the first time that an elf stands in your presence. A vampire and an elf...now there's a pair.

"I am Ryan Shard." The oldest member of the group says and you incline your head slightly. "Yes, vampire, I am a wizard." He says.

"Ah." You reply. You know you must choose one of them to accompany you but you feel the hunger of blood pressing so near you. "I will decide tomorrow."

"Tomorrow?" Ryan asks.

"We can rest here." You say as you indicate the hotel against which you are leaning. "They are very discreet." You say.

"Very well." Eternelle replies and you allow yourself to bask in her purity. Even the purest mortal pales beside an elf. Even you, a hardened vampire, would never drink the blood of an elf. The consequences are too great, the death too painful.

You straighten up from the wall and lead the group inside. As you all seperate, you head for your room, your mind racing.

"Why must I choose only one?" You ask the shadowy figure that occupies the chair in the corner of the small room.

"I never said one." It hisses as you lay upon the bed. "You complained so much I assumed you only wanted one. Take all of them for all I care!"

"No, no. Two will be enough." You say as you stare at the open curtains. "Don't you need to close these?" You ask coldly. You are the only vampire able to live through sunlight. A blessing...and a curse.

"No. I will be gone before the sun rises." It hisses and you shut your eyes. "When will you choose?"

"Tomorrow...I wasted today." You say as you fall into comfortable slumber.
1.title: Drinking...no wait...sleeping.

choices: (can you see where I'm going with this?)  Ryan and Shyntar
11.content:
You watch them sitting at a table in the corner, talking, you are positive, about you.

You move forward and grace them with a smile. "I bid you good morning." You say.

"Choose." Ryan states and you feel hungrier than ever. You never did feast last night. You must find someone today.

"Very well. Don't grow a tail." You say as you smile and choose your companions on the strange journey of fates.
11.title: Choosing Two

111.content:
Shyntar looks up in shock and you notice his eyes are rimmed in red.

"Let's not waste time. I will meet you back here in an hour." You say as you head for the door.

"Where are you going?" Lily asks.

"To break my fast." You say.

As you step out into the sunlight, you hear her say, "Isn't he a vampire?" And you allow yourself a laugh as you seek out your prey.

You find yourself a fat woman sitting inside her dim house crying about lonliness. It is cruel to let her live so you kill her. You have plenty of time before you must return to the inn but your are no longer hungry. You must occupy your time. After a moment of ponderous thought, you decide on your next course of action.
111.title: Breaking Fast

1111.content:
Your feet turn and lead you in the direction of the docks before you can even determine if you long for ale or not.

You watch the sailors working against the deep blue of the sea. You envy them slightly until you remember all the times you spent in the dank darkness of a ships bowels.

The captain of the ship had offered you friendship. Naive and anxious to rid yourself of lonliness, you accepted. In truth, he was a slave trader and believed you to bring a great price across the sea.

Their surprise and dismay was evident when they ventured below at journey's end and found all the other 'cargo' dead. You killed the captain slowly, disembarking into a strange land with stranger customs.

As you watch the ships, you dream of a simpler life, and of the woman you loved so tenderly the night before you died. She had sworn to love you forever. How little she realized. Forever is a long time...when you're damned. You turn and find a man glaring at you coldly.

"What?" You ask as you look over his shoulder at the sign hanging over the tavern's door. Yes, you decide, ale is definately what you want.

"You killed my brother." The man says, his voice harsh and emotionless.

"And your sister more than likely." You say.

"I don't have a sister." He growls.

"Then consider yourself blessed, for, if you had a sister, she too would have fallen prey to me." You say as you reach up to bring the man's broad neck into your reach.

"Damn you to Hell, devil!" He cries out and you feel a sharp pain in your heart. You look down and see the wooden stake protruding from your chest. "Die for your sins and burn eternal!"

You feel your legs crumbling beneath you, turning slowly to dust. If only you had seen this coming, you think to yourself. If only you had gone to the tavern instead.
1111.title: To the docks!

choices: Time to return to the Inn
1112.content:
Despite the earliness of the day, your feet turn and lead you in the direction of the tavern before you can even determine if you long for ale or not, feeding on a few mortals along the way. You only embrace them, only slightly call them too you like an old friend, and leave them to return to their lives dazed and slightly lighter.

You can see the sailors working against the deep blue of the sea in the distance. You envy them slightly until you remember all the times you spent in the dank darkness of a ships bowels.

The captain of the ship had offered you friendship. Naive and anxious to rid yourself of lonliness, you accepted. In truth, he was a slave trader and believed you to bring a great price across the sea.

Their surprise and dismay was evident when they ventured below at journey's end and found all the other 'cargo' dead. You killed the captain slowly, disembarking into a strange land with stranger customs.

As you watch the ships, you dream of a simpler life, and of the woman you loved so tenderly the night before you died. She had sworn to love you forever. How little she realized. Forever is a long time...when you're damned. You enter the dark tavern and sit at a single table in the far corner.

A barmaid swoops in to take your order. "Ale." You bark. Truly, vampires have no use for alcohol, you just savor the taste. Drinking ale makes you feel almost human. Almost.

She brings you your ale and you toss a silver coin upon the table. She deftly pockets it and moves away, leaving you to wonder if you will have to pay for your drink again. Most women took the money and never said a word. It truly didn't matter...she seems as if she needs it.

You sip the liquid and study the man behind the bar. He seems strangly familiar. After a long while of brainsearching, you shrug it off and finish your ale.
1112.title: To the tavern!

11121.content:
You toss another silver on the table as you stand and head for the door. The man steps out from behind the bar, his eyes glinting coldly. You try to recall who he is but you can't bring a name to mind.

"What?" You ask as you look over his shoulder at the tavern's door. "I paid. I paid double actually."

"You have not paid enough. You killed my brother." The man says, his voice harsh and emotionless.

"And your sister more than likely." You say.

"I don't have a sister." He growls.

"Then consider yourself blessed, for, if you had a sister, she too would have fallen prey to me." You say as you suddenly remember his brother, who looked so much like the man before you. As he moves forward, you reach up and grab hold of his head, giving it a cruel twist. A snap is heard and you smile slightly as his large body falls to the floor. No one pays you any mind as you step over his body and out into the bright sunlight.
11121.title: Tavern Woes

choices: Your ale arrives and you drink deeply.
111211.content:
You walk up the near empty street with a bounce in your step. Death, whenever it came to claim you completely, always excited you when you beat it, once again.

You enter the Inn and see Lily eating a heel of bread, her long golden blonde hair flowing free about her shoulders, cascading down her back in a waterfall of curls. Shyntar is nowhere to be seen.

You close in on her, breathing in the scent of her life. She starts when you touch her hair. She turns around and stands, her green eyes darkening slightly as she looks at you.

"When do we leave?" She asks, her voice soft and sweet. You have no idea what her strength is but you comfort yourself with the fact that you could always sample her charms.

"Soon. Where is Shyntar?" You ask and her eyes widen slightly. She looks about but you know he is not in the room.

"I do not know." She says.

"Ah, well, we wait then." You say as you pull the chair back for her in an obvious show of chilvary. She looks about her one more time before she sits and begins eating once more.

You take the chair opposite of her and wave the serving wench over. "Ale." You say and she heads off to fulfill your request. You won't pay for this ale, you decide, since the last time almost got you killed.
111211.title: The Inn

1112111.content:
You swallow the last of your second mug of ale when Shyntar enters the room. You watch him stand at the base of the wooden stairs, his dark gaze sweeping the oblivious people.

You let your gaze fall upon Lily. She is drumming her fingers restlessly upon the tabletop, her chin resting upon her other hand. She is unaware that Shyntar has returned.

You allow your eyes to fall upon Shyntar as he steps away from the stairs and moves toward you. His thick black cloak floats behind him like a dark angel's wings.

His steps are slow and purposeful, light and easy. You notice how he seems to float toward you, his cloak drifting back with every third step, revealing the taunting glint of metal.

Even before Shyntar reaches you, you know who he is. A slow smile touches your lips as you understand the importance of your decision.

"Are we prepared to leave?" Shyntar asks, his voice smooth as silk and just as cool.

"What's the hurry?" You ask, content to bide your time. Assuming your guess is correct, you allow your smile to broaden.

"Tell me, Bloome, what you intend to do here?" Shyntar asks as he occupies the seat between you and Lily.

You wave the maiden over and she places a fresh mug of ale before you. "Drink." You say as you swallow. "And talk."

"About?" Shyntar asks as he catches the girl's eye. You are silently impressed at the haste with which she fetches his ale.

You lean back, open you mouth and speak.
1112111.title: Shyntar Returns

11121111.content:
"What else would we talk about?" You continue to smile to yourself as the maiden places the mug of ale before Shyntar. Best not to reveal your ace, at least not yet.

"Do you not think that is a conversation best left for a more private area?" Lacing your fingers behind your head you watch as he fingers his mug.

"As I said, they are very discreet here. No one hears anything than their own affairs." You glance around and, as you expected, everyone is intent on minding their own business. When your gaze returns to the table you notice that Lily doesn't appear very interested. Why would she not be interested in a conversation about the mission the three of you are to embark upon? She seems to be gazing absentmindedly at something far off in the distance between you and Shyntar. However, her fingers have stopped drumming on the tabletop.

"Have it your way," you say as you rise to your feet. "If the two of you are ready to go we should head out. We can discuss the mission on the way." Both Lily and Shyntar follow suit and stand up. Lily places some coins on the table for her meal. Shyntar likewise places a coin on the table for his ale, despite the fact that he did not drink a sip. Smiling you lead the two outside where everything is ready.
11121111.title: Hidden Ace

"Damn you to Hell, devil!" He cries out and you feel a sharp pain in your heart. You look down and see the wooden stake protruding from your chest. "Die for your sins and burn eternal!"

You feel your legs crumbling beneath you, turning slowly to dust. If only you had seen this coming, you think to yourself. If only you had gone to the tavern instead.
1141.title: To the docks!

choices: Time to return to the Inn
1142.content:
Despite the earliness of the day, your feet turn and lead you in the direction of the tavern before you can even determine if you long for ale or not, feeding on a few mortals along the way. You only embrace them, only slightly call them too you like an old friend, and leave them to return to their lives dazed and slightly lighter.

You can see the sailors working against the deep blue of the sea in the distance. You envy them slightly until you remember all the times you spent in the dank darkness of a ships bowels.

The captain of the ship had offered you friendship. Naive and anxious to rid yourself of lonliness, you accepted. In truth, he was a slave trader and believed you to bring a great price across the sea.

Their surprise and dismay was evident when they ventured below at journey's end and found all the other 'cargo' dead. You killed the captain slowly, disembarking into a strange land with stranger customs.

As you watch the ships, you dream of a simpler life, and of the woman you loved so tenderly the night before you died. She had sworn to love you forever. How little she realized. Forever is a long time...when you're damned. You enter the dark tavern and sit at a single table in the far corner.

A barmaid swoops in to take your order. "Ale." You bark. Truly, vampires have no use for alcohol, you just savor the taste. Drinking ale makes you feel almost human. Almost.

She brings you your ale and you toss a silver coin upon the table. She deftly pockets it and moves away, leaving you to wonder if you will have to pay for your drink again. Most women took the money and never said a word. It truly didn't matter...she seems as if she needs it.

You sip the liquid and study the man behind the bar. He seems strangly familiar. After a long while of brainsearching, you shrug it off and finish your ale.
1142.title: To the tavern!

11421.content:
You toss another silver on the table as you stand and head for the door. The man steps out from behind the bar, his eyes glinting coldly. You try to recall who he is but you can't bring a name to mind.

"What?" You ask as you look over his shoulder at the tavern's door. "I paid. I paid double actually."

"You have not paid enough. You killed my brother." The man says, his voice harsh and emotionless.

"And your sister more than likely." You say.

"I don't have a sister." He growls.

"Then consider yourself blessed, for, if you had a sister, she too would have fallen prey to me." You say as you suddenly remember his brother, who looked so much like the man before you. As he moves forward, you reach up and grab hold of his head, giving it a cruel twist. A snap is heard and you smile slightly as his large body falls to the floor. No one pays you any mind as you step over his body and out into the bright sunlight.
11421.title: Tavern Woes

choices: Your ale arrives and you drink deeply.
114211.content:
You walk up the near empty street with a bounce in your step. Death, whenever it came to claim you completely, always excited you when you beat it, once again.

You enter the Inn and see Ryan tracing a shape carved into the table. He is tall and slender, even sitting, but you can see the shape of his muscles through his thick clothing. You silenty think that you never want to be on the recieving end of his vengeance. Shyntar is nowhere to be seen.

You close in on him, trying to avoid alerting him of your presence.

"I know you are here, Bloome." He says as he continues to trace the crude carving with his index finger. "When do we leave?" He asks, his voice deep and soothing, reaching you effortlessly although you swear he is whispering.

"Soon. Where is Shyntar?" You ask and he shakes his head.

"I do not know." He says.

"Ah, well, we wait then." You say as you take the chair opposite of him and wave the serving wench over. "Ale." You say. The girl leaves to fulfill your request. The sway of her hips brings a smile to your lips. Ryan lifts his gaze from the shape on the table and lifts an eyebrow. "What?" You ask.

"A vampire drinking ale?" He says.

"And walking in sunlight." You reply coldly. "Where will it end?"

Ryan shrugs and returns his gaze to the shape on the table top. You look away and wait for your ale to arrive. You won't pay for this ale, you decide, since the last time almost got you killed.
114211.title: The Inn

1142111.content:
You swallow the last of your second mug of ale when Shyntar enters the room. You watch him stand at the base of the wooden stairs, his dark gaze sweeping the oblivious people.

You glance at Ryan, wondering how much power he truly possesses and how much is just tricks. You lean back in your chair as he lifts his eyes and meets your gaze.

"Very powerful, undead one." He says proudly before lowering his gaze to the table once more. "Our long lost third has returned, evidently." He says.

You allow your eyes to fall upon Shyntar as he steps away from the stairs and moves toward you. His thick black cloak floats behind him like a dark angel's wings.

His steps are slow and purposeful, light and easy. You notice how he seems to float toward you, his cloak drifting back with every third step, revealing the taunting glint of metal.

Even before Shyntar reaches you, you know who he is. A slow smile touches your lips as you understand the importance of your decision.

"Are we prepared to leave?" Shyntar asks, his voice smooth as silk and just as cool.

"What's the hurry?" You ask, content to bide your time. Assuming your guess is correct, you allow your smile to broaden.

"Tell me, Bloome, what you intend to do here?" Shyntar asks as he slides into the seat between you and Ryan.

You wave the maiden over and she places a fresh mug of ale before you. "Drink." You say as you swallow. "And talk."

"About?" Shyntar asks as he catches the girl's eye. You are silently impressed at the haste with which she fetches his ale.

You lean back, open you mouth and speak.
1142111.title: Shyntar Returns

info.brief_description: Unlikely partnerships lead to unwise decisions...sometimes.
info.description:
This is a story where I am trying to mix the imagination in with reality. Unfortunately, if this gets terribly offbase, I don't blame you for not reading or contributing. I have no idea, actually, where this story is likely to go. I'm blind leading all of you into the darkness...are you willing to come?

Don't be offended if you add a chapter and I delete it...I'm just evil like that. Keep an eye on the content rating because it may change. For now, it's low, so be kind.
